Dave Ramsey: s denial: The expert's verdict mentions that Dave Ramsey himself posted a message on Facebook clarifying that he did not author the viral post. This denial from the supposed author is a significant aspect in verifying the authenticity of the claim.
Internet posts predating the claim: The expert's verdict states that versions of the text were found on the internet as far back as October 2020, and at that time, Dave Ramsey was not credited as the author. This aspect suggests that the claim attributing the post to Ramsey is false.
Original author identified: The expert's verdict reveals that the original author of the post is "Bruce Hendry," and it was published on the right-wing website FrontPageMag.com on October 7, 2020. This aspect provides evidence that someone else wrote the post, further discrediting the claim about Dave Ramsey.
Misinformation and factual inaccuracies: The expert's verdict highlights that many items listed in the viral post are based on misinformation and factual inaccuracies. For example, it mentions that Joe Biden did not blackmail the President of Ukraine and that viruses do not have nationalities. This aspect indicates that the content of the post is unreliable and undermines its credibility.
